children.subject: Ah, you won't hear back by 1/6 since we want to give everyone enough time to apply. You would hear back on 1/10 at the earliest, but most likely during the week of 1/13. Sorry about this! Maybe you could contact your other offer and inquire about your options.
When should we expect to hear back? I need to reply to another offer by Monday 1/6

history.content:
Hi! We are looking for qualified students to become Group Tutors for Spring 2020. 

 

Starting Spring 2020, DS100 will have Group Tutors instead of Readers. 

  • If you have already applied for a Reader position, no further action is required on your part. You will automatically be considered for a Group Tutor position. 

  • If you have not yet applied, please apply under the Reader heading here ASAP: https://deptapps.coe.berkeley.edu/ase/eecs/apply. Please note that we have not changed the heading on the form, but the positions will be Group Tutors instead of Readers.

 

Positions are for 8 hours a week. The weekly responsibilities of a Group Tutor are:

  • Prepare for teaching the week’s content

  • Hold one office hour a week

  • Grade written portions of weekly assignments

  • Attend a meeting of all tutors

  • Provide proctoring support for the midterm and final

 

All of the data science courses, and the students in them, have benefited greatly from outstanding staff teams. The staff benefit from being part of a highly skilled and close-knit teaching community naturally includes peer support in studying, making course/research/internship/job choices, and just hanging out. We hope you will join the team!
